sentences: Fox News accidentally puts up a poll graphic that shows how they are the least trusted networ
label: false_

sentences: When host Howard Kurtz asked for a poll to be put up on the screen that asks if the media reports fake news, viewers got a look at the wrong poll – one put out by Monmouth University that asks people which network they trust more, CNN, MSNBC, or Fox News.
label: false_

sentences: Not surprising but a knee-slapper nonetheless, the graphic for the poll showed that people trusted CNN most, at 48%, followed by MSNBC at 45%.
label: false_

sentences: Fox came in last place with a mere 30% of those polled thinking that the network was trustworthy.Kurtz quickly said, "This is not the graphic we're looking for – hold off.
label: false_

sentences: Yes, Fox did accidentally put up the wrong poll graphic, but Fox has since pointed out that the confusing graphic wasn't actually showing that Fox is the least trusted network.
label: true_

sentences: Instead, what the graphic intended to do was to compare CNN, MSNBC and Fox News to Trump.
label: true_

sentences: The graphic asks who people trust more, CNN or Trump, MSNBC or Trump, and Fox News or Trump.
label: true_

sentences: When looking at it this way, people trust all three networks more than they trust Trump.
label: true_

sentences: During a Fox news segment in which Republican strategist Frank Luntz thought the media should give Trump more credit for the nation's economic "clear recovery," someone behind the scenes made a boo boo.
label: true_
